intro: Ypsilopus furcistipes, commonly known as the forked-stemmed ypsilopus, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Central America. It is characterized by its delicate, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white and pale pink. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, Ypsilopus furcistipes is considered endangered and is protected in several national parks.
